At Accenture Federal Services, nothing matters more than helping the US federal government make the nation stronger and safer and life better for people. Our 13,000+ people are united in a shared purpose to pursue the limitless potential of technology and ingenuity for clients across defense, national security, public safety, civilian, and military health organizations. Join Accenture Federal Services, a technology company and part of global Accenture, to do work that matters in a collaborative and caring community, where you feel like you belong and are empowered to grow, learn and thrive through hands-on experience, certifications, industry training and more. Join us to drive positive, lasting change that moves missions and the government forward! Data and AI Analyst Start Your Career Where Innovation Meets Purpose At Accenture Federal Services, we help the U.S. federal government make the nation stronger, safer, and better for all. Our 13,000+ team members are united by a shared purpose: to harness the limitless potential of technology and human ingenuity for clients across defense, national security, public safety, civilian, and military health organizations. Join a collaborative and caring community where you belong, and where your growth is our priority. As an entry-level analyst, you’ll gain hands-on experience, earn industry certifications, and receive structured training that builds on your engineering mindset—applying creativity and analytical thinking to solve real-world challenges. We’re writing the playbook for how to be the most AI-enabled, client-focused, and people-first organization. Our reinventors are driving faster value for clients and shaping the future of government services. Are you ready to reinvent what’s possible? It’s your career, your life, and your choice. Let’s build something that matters—together. The Opportunity At AFS, our Data & AI Analysts help federal agencies unlock the power of data and artificial intelligence to drive smarter decisions, faster operations, and better outcomes for the nation. You’ll begin your journey with immersive training in data engineering, analytics, and AI integration—building the skills to solve complex challenges across defense, national security, and civilian sectors. In this role, you’ll apply your engineering mindset to design and implement data-driven solutions using modern tools, cloud platforms, and AI frameworks. You’ll work side-by-side with teammates to experiment with emerging technologies, adopt next-generation IT, and deliver mission-critical insights that move government forward. What You’ll Do: Design, build, and maintain data pipelines and analytics platforms using tools like Python, SQL, Spark, and cloud-native services. Apply machine learning and AI techniques to extract insights, automate processes, and support predictive decision-making. Leverage frameworks such as Agentic AI to develop intelligent systems that adapt and respond to dynamic mission needs. Visualize data and communicate findings using tools like Tableau, Power BI, and custom dashboards. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI models into operational workflows and ensure responsible, secure use of data. Experiment with emerging technologies and next-gen architectures to accelerate solution delivery and scale impact. What You’ll Learn AI engineering and model deployment using platforms like TensorFlow and PyTorch. Data architecture, cloud analytics, and scalable data processing on AWS, Azure, or GCP. job_title: AI and Automation Programmer Analyst - Associate - SAP S/4HANA Implementation
job_description: Requisition ID # 168090 Job Category: Information Technology Job Level: Individual Contributor Business Unit: Information Technology Work Type: Hybrid Job Location: Oakland Department Overview The SAP Program Office leads the strategic implementation of SAP S/4HANA across the organization, driving digital transformation and operational excellence. The team partners closely with business units and IT to modernize core enterprise processes, enhance data-driven decision-making, and integrate emerging technologies such as AI and automation. Through cross-functional collaboration and innovation, the SAP Program Office ensures scalable, future-ready solutions that align with organizational goals and industry best practices. Position Summary The AI and Automation Associate will play a key role in identifying, designing, and prototyping automation and artificial intelligence (AI) use cases within the SAP S/4HANA implementation program. The role involves collaborating with business process owners, IT stakeholders, and the SAP project team to analyze end-to-end processes, identify automation or AI opportunities, and build proof-of-concept (POC) solutions using modern automation and AI tools. This is a hands-on role combining process understanding, technical experimentation, and stakeholder engagement to accelerate innovation within the SAP transformation journey. PG&E is providing the hourly rate range that the company in good faith believes it might pay for this position at the time of the job posting. This compensation range is specific to the locality of the job. The actual hourly rate paid to an individual will be based on multiple factors, including, but not limited to, specific skills, education, licenses or certifications, experience, market value, geographic location, and internal equity. Although we estimate the successful candidate hired into this role will be placed between the entry point and the middle of the range, the decision will be made on a case-by-case basis related to these factors. This job is also eligible to participate in PG&E’s discretionary incentive compensation programs The hourly rate for this position ranges from $33.65/hour to $50.96/hour Job Responsibilities Process Analysis & Opportunity Identification Work closely with SAP functional and business teams to understand key business processes being implemented in S/4HANA (e.g., Finance, Procurement, Supply Chain, Manufacturing). Identify potential areas were AI, machine learning (ML), or automation (RPA, workflow, etc.) can enhance process efficiency, accuracy, or user experience. Document use cases and define measurable business outcomes for AI/automation opportunities. Solution Design & Prototyping Develop proof-of-concepts (POCs) and prototypes using AI and automation tools (e.g., SAP BTP, SAP AI Core, UiPath, Power Automate, Python-based AI tools, etc.). Integrate prototypes with SAP environments and relevant data sources where applicable. Validate feasibility and potential business value of proposed solutions. Stakeholder Collaboration Conduct workshops and demos with business and IT stakeholders to showcase prototypes and gather feedback. Support change management and adoption of automation/AI initiatives. Collaborate with enterprise architects and data teams to ensure scalability and alignment with the overall SAP transformation roadmap. Continuous Learning & Innovation Stay current on emerging AI and automation technologies relevant to enterprise systems and SAP ecosystem. Contribute to internal knowledge sharing, best practices, and innovation pipeline. Qualifications Minimum: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or equivalent experience and/or field of study Strong understanding in process analysis, automation, or AI-related projects. 1 year of programming analysis experience or internship experience. Must have a degree conferred by the start date. Must have permanent authorization to work full time (40 hours a week) in the United States. PG&E will not provide visa or immigration support. Basic understanding of the technical components of the job. Basic understanding of software, how it works, and how it often breaks. Desired: Graduating in Fall 2025 or Spring 2026. Familiarity with SAP S/4HANA modules and business processes. Familiarity with one or more automation or AI tools (e.g., UiPath, Automation Anywhere, SAP BTP, Python, TensorFlow, Azure AI, etc.). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an innovative mindset. Excellent communication and presentation skills, especially for stakeholder demos. Ability to create basic test beds, create test scenarios, create regression tests, document and assess software reliability. Experience working on or supporting SAP implementation or digital transformation programs. Knowledge of data analytics, machine learning model lifecycle, or AI integration with enterprise systems. Exposure to SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation (iRPA) or SAP AI Core/Launchpad. Certification in AI/ML, RPA, or SAP technologies is a plus. Key Competencies: Process Thinking and Analytical Skills Curiosity and Innovation Mindset Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement Prototyping and Technical Experimentation Business Value Orientation Success Metrics: Number and quality of AI/automation use cases identified and validated POC/Prototype delivery within project timelines Positive stakeholder feedback and adoption rate of proposed solutions Contribution to overall process efficiency and digital innovation within the SAP program

Company OverviewKLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and we invest 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.Group/DivisionWith over 40 years of semiconductor process control experience, chipmakers around the globe rely on KLA to ensure that their fabs ramp next-generation devices to volume production quickly and cost-effectively. Enabling the movement towards advanced chip design, KLA's Global Products Group (GPG), which is responsible for creating all of KLA’s metrology and inspection products, is looking for the best and the brightest research scientist, software engineers, application development engineers, and senior product technology process engineers. Central Engineering is KLA's largest engineering organization comprised of 9 Centers-of-Excellence (CoE) in various disciplines applied across all product groups in the company. These CoE include Handling & Automation, Precision Motion Control, Sensors & Image Acquisition, Platform Design, and Packaging Engineering, among others. Talent includes over 500 engineers across global centers in Israel, China, India, and the US. Each CoE contributes not just talent and deliverables per discipline toward product programs, but also subject matter expertise, best practices, roadmaps, specialized facilities, apparatus, models, and analytics. These differentiate KLA not only in WHAT we do, but also in HOW we do it.Job Description/Preferred QualificationsResponsibilitiesBring your validated experience to build new algorithms for KLAs innovative inspection products. Help drive creative ideas, implement proof of concepts, productizing and evaluating new algorithms! By providing technical expertise you will be supporting other team members, collaborators, and customers. This is an opportunity to work on innovative problems where you will become an authority and indispensable within the KLA Algorithm team. Solidify your depth of knowledge while growing your scope of responsibilities to become a leader in the Computer Vision field.QualificationsAcademic experience required in development in Computer VisionDeep understanding of image processing and machine learning as they relate to computer vision is requiredExperience prototyping Algorithms using MATLAB or Python is requiredVery strong experience with C++ coding is highly preferredFull stack hands-on experience with data and backend infrastructure and front-end and user interface for algorithms is highly preferredFamiliarity with any of the following is a plus: Generative AI, CUDA/GPU Programming frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow or PyTorch), and Data Analysis and Visualization toolsGreat teammate with excellent problem-solving and written and verbal communication skills, as demonstrated by practical experience in academic or work projects or internships.What will differentiate you The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of innovative research in computer vision algorithms. Hands on experience solving computer vision challenges, strong image processing fundamentals, and an appreciation of complex image acquisition systems are highly desirable.Minimum QualificationsDoctorate (Academic) Degree and 0 years related work experience; Master's Level Degree and related work experience of 3 years; Bachelor's Level Degree and related work experience of 5 yearsBase Pay Range: $100,000.00 - $170,000.00 AnnuallyPrimary Location: USA-MI-Ann Arbor-KLAKLA’s total rewards package for employees may also include participation in performance incentive programs and eligibility for additional benefits including but not limited to: medical, dental, vision, life, and other voluntary benefits, 401(K) including company matching, employee stock purchase program (ESPP), student debt assistance, tuition reimbursement program, development and career growth opportunities and programs, financial planning benefits, wellness benefits including an employee assistance program (EAP), paid time off and paid company holidays, and family care and bonding leave.Interns are eligible for some of the benefits listed.
